verses.verse: (Israel’s Continuing Rebellion) (Ezek 8.1, 11, 12; 9.6) In the seventh year, in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, certain elders of Israel came to consult the LORD and sat down before me.
And the word of the LORD came to me:
Mortal, speak to the elders of Israel, and say to them: Thus says the Lord GOD: Why are you coming? To consult me? As I live, says the Lord GOD, I will not be consulted by you.
(Ezek 16.2; 22.2) Will you judge them, mortal; will you judge them? Then let them know the abominations of their ancestors

(Ex 6.2, 3, 7; 20.2; Deut 7.6) and say to them: Thus says the Lord GOD: On the day when I chose Israel, I swore to the offspring of the house of Jacob—making myself known to them in the land of Egypt—I swore to them, saying, “I am the LORD your God.”

(Ex 3.8, 17; Deut 8.7-9; Ps 48.2; Jer 32.22; Dan 8.9) On that day I swore to them that I would bring them out of the land of Egypt into a land that I had searched out for them, a land flowing with milk and honey, the most glorious of all lands.

(Ex 20.2; Deut 29.16, 18; Ezek 18.31) And I said to them, “Cast away the detestable things on which your eyes feast, every one of you, and do not defile yourselves with the idols of Egypt; I am the LORD your God.”

(Isa 63.10; Ezek 7.8) But they rebelled against me and would not listen to me; not one of them cast away the detestable things on which their eyes feasted, nor did they forsake the idols of Egypt. Then I thought I would pour out my wrath upon them and spend my anger against them in the midst of the land of Egypt.

(Ex 32.12; Num 14.13ff; Ezek 36.21; 39.7) But I acted for the sake of my name, that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations among whom they lived, in whose sight I made myself known to them in bringing them out of the land of Egypt.
(Ex 13.18) So I led them out of the land of Egypt and brought them into the wilderness.
(Lev 18.5; Deut 4.8; Rom 10.5; Gal 3.12) I gave them my statutes and showed them my ordinances, by whose observance everyone shall live.
(Ex 31.13, 17) Moreover, I gave them my Sabbaths, as a sign between me and them, so that they might know that I the LORD sanctify them.

(Num 14.22, 29; Ps 78.40; 95.8-10; 106.23; Prov 1.25) But the house of Israel rebelled against me in the wilderness; they did not observe my statutes but rejected my ordinances, by whose observance everyone shall live, and my Sabbaths they greatly profaned. Then I thought I would pour out my wrath upon them in the wilderness, to make an end of them.
But I acted for the sake of my name, so that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations, in whose sight I had brought them out.
(Num 14.28; Ps 95.11) Moreover, I swore to them in the wilderness that I would not bring them into the land that I had given them, a land flowing with milk and honey, the most glorious of all lands,
(Num 15.39; Ps 78.37; Am 5.25) because they rejected my ordinances and did not observe my statutes and profaned my Sabbaths, for their heart went after their idols.
Nevertheless, my eye spared them, and I did not destroy them or make an end of them in the wilderness.
I said to their children in the wilderness, “Do not follow the statutes of your parents, nor observe their ordinances, nor defile yourselves with their idols.
(Ex 6.7; Deut 5.32) I the LORD am your God; follow my statutes, be careful to observe my ordinances,
and hallow my Sabbaths that they may be a sign between me and you, so that you may know that I the LORD am your God.”

(Num 25.1) But the children rebelled against me; they did not follow my statutes and were not careful to observe my ordinances, by whose observance everyone shall live; they profaned my Sabbaths. Then I thought I would pour out my wrath upon them and spend my anger against them in the wilderness.
(vv 9, 14|EZK 20:914; Ps 78.38) But I withheld my hand and acted for the sake of my name, so that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations, in whose sight I had brought them out.
(Lev 26.33; Deut 28.64; Ps 106.27; Jer 15.4) Moreover, I swore to them in the wilderness that I would scatter them among the nations and disperse them through the countries,
because they had not executed my ordinances but had rejected my statutes and profaned my Sabbaths, and their eyes were set on their ancestors’ idols.
(Ps 81.12; Rom 1.24; 2 Thess 2.11) Moreover, I gave them statutes that were not good and ordinances by which they could not live.

(v 30|EZK 20:30; 2 Kings 17.17; 2 Chr 28.3; Ezek 6.7; 16.20, 21) I defiled them through their very gifts, in their offering up all their firstborn, in order that I might horrify them, so that they might know that I am the LORD.

(Ezek 2.7; 18.24; 39.23, 26; Rom 2.24) Therefore, mortal, speak to the house of Israel and say to them: Thus says the Lord GOD: In this again your ancestors blasphemed me by dealing treacherously with me.

(Isa 57.5-7; Ezek 6.13; 16.19) For when I had brought them into the land that I swore to give them, then wherever they saw any high hill or any leafy tree, there they offered their sacrifices and presented the provocation of their offering; there they sent up their pleasing odors, and there they poured out their drink offerings.
(I said to them, “What is the high place to which you go? So it is called Bamah (That is, high place) to this day.”)
Therefore say to the house of Israel: Thus says the Lord GOD: Will you defile yourselves after the manner of your ancestors and go astray after their detestable things?

(Ps 106.37-39; Jer 7.31; Ezek 16.20) When you offer your gifts and make your children pass through the fire, you defile yourselves with all your idols to this day. And shall I be consulted by you, O house of Israel? As I live, says the Lord GOD, I will not be consulted by you.
What is in your mind shall never happen—the thought, “Let us be like the nations, like the tribes of the countries, and worship wood and stone.”
(God Will Restore Israel) (Jer 21.5) As I live, says the Lord GOD, surely with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm and with wrath poured out, I will be king over you.
I will bring you out from the peoples and gather you out of the countries where you are scattered, with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm and with wrath poured out,
(Ezek 17.20) and I will bring you into the wilderness of the peoples, and there I will enter into judgment with you face to face.
(vv 13, 21|EZK 20:1321; Deut 32.10; 1 Cor 10.5-10) As I entered into judgment with your ancestors in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so I will enter into judgment with you, says the Lord GOD.
(Jer 33.13; Ezek 16.60, 62) I will make you pass under the staff and will bring you within the bond of the covenant.

(Jer 44.14; Ezek 6.7; 34.17, 20; Am 9.9, 10) I will purge out the rebels among you and those who transgress against me; I will bring them out of the land where they reside as aliens, but they shall not enter the land of Israel. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.

(Isa 1.13; Jer 44.25, 26; Ezek 23.38, 39; Am 4.4) As for you, O house of Israel, thus says the Lord GOD: Go serve your idols, every one of you now and hereafter, if you will not listen to me, but my holy name you shall no more profane with your gifts and your idols.

(Isa 56.7; 60.7; Ezek 17.23; 37.22, 24; Mic 4.1; Mal 3.4) For on my holy mountain, the mountain height of Israel, says the Lord GOD, there all the house of Israel, all of them, shall serve me in the land; there I will accept them, and there I will require your contributions and the choicest of your gifts, with all your sacred things.

(Eph 5.2; Phil 4.18) As a pleasing odor I will accept you, when I bring you out from the peoples and gather you out of the countries where you have been scattered, and I will manifest my holiness among you in the sight of the nations.
(Ezek 34.13; 36.24) You shall know that I am the LORD when I bring you into the land of Israel, the country that I swore to give to your ancestors.

(Ezek 16.61; 36.31; Hos 5.15; Zech 12.10) There you shall remember your ways and all the deeds by which you have polluted yourselves, and you shall loathe yourselves for all the evils that you have committed.
(Ezek 36.22) And you shall know that I am the LORD when I deal with you for my name’s sake, not according to your evil ways or corrupt deeds, O house of Israel, says the Lord GOD.
(A Prophecy against the Negeb) (21.1 in Heb) The word of the LORD came to me:
(Ezek 6.2; 21.2) Mortal, set your face toward the south, preach against the south, and prophesy against the forest land in the Negeb;

(Jer 17.24; 21.4, 14) say to the forest of the Negeb: Hear the word of the LORD: Thus says the Lord GOD: I will kindle a fire in you, and it shall devour every green tree in you and every dry tree; the blazing flame shall not be quenched, and all faces from south to north shall be scorched by it.
(Jer 7.20; 17.27) All flesh shall see that I the LORD have kindled it; it shall not be quenched.
(Ezek 17.2; Mt 13.13, 14) Then I said, “Ah Lord GOD! They are saying of me, ‘Is he not a maker of allegories?’ ”
